pull.title: qt: Move AppInit2 and Shutdown to a thread
pull.body:
Run initialization and shutdown in their own thread instead of the UI thread.
- Allows a more responsive splash screen (goes away immediately when clicked!)
- Prevents `Process does not respond` messages from the window system while initializing (common complaint)
- Show a `Bitcoin Core is shutting down...` window while shutting down
- ~~Hopefully~~ fixes Ubuntu issue #1242 preventing the menu and icon from appearing
- Cleans up the initialization code by moving initialization phases into methods on the Application object

repo.name: bitcoin
repo.description: Laanwj's Bitcoin Core fork - see README.md on "readme" branch

issue.title: Bitcoin-Qt 0.6.2 for Ubuntu 12.04 invisible in systray, no global menu
issue.body: After the update, the program does not appear in the system tray. Also there is no global menu.

events.body: Testing in #1242 confirms that the Ubuntu menu+icon issue is solved by these changes.

events.message:
qt: Move initialization/shutdown to a thread

Move AppInit2 and Shutdown to a thread.

This allows a more responsive splash screen, prevents 'process does not respond'
messages from the window system and will allow for showing a user friendly
window while shutting down.

qt: Show window while shutting down

Makes it clear to the user that the application is still wrapping up
and the computer should not be turned off until it is finished.

qt: Remove global references in bitcoin.cpp

Remove the need for global references `guiref` and
`splashref` by making the BitcoinGUI and SplashScreen
classes register for the UI interface signals themselves.

qt: Stop shutdown detection timer during shutdown

Stop the shutdown timer from exiting the main loop
when shutdown is already in progress.

Fixes seeming hanging window after typing 'stop' in debug console.

Also hide the debug console during shutdown as it is useless without
a core to connect to.

events.body:

Contact BlueMatt on freenode if something looks broken.

issue.title: Ubuntu issue #1242 from bitcoin (qt menus disappearing)
issue.body:
Kia ora Rob
I thought I was packaging poorly, but it turns out that there is a qt issue with Unity and thus most Ubuntu users. While the original issue raised cites Ubuntu 1204, I can confirm that it affects the Unity desktop in 1404-1504.  laanwj at bitcoin has already resolved it. the issue was raised here:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/1242
The issue was resolved with the commits here:
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/3493
Let me know if this is something you can work on in the near term, or if I should attempt to use laanwj's commits as a patch in my builds. I'd rather not mess around under the hood, to be honest. I'm neither a c or a qt programmer, and besides, the whole idea with packaging is to keep the trust by using the upstream code for the builds and only tweaking at the edges.
Cheers
Rick (caraka)

issue.title: Minimize to tray not recovered from fully on Ubuntu
issue.body:
Bitcoin Classic version v1.2.5.0-18bd3372 (64-bit)
* compiled from source
Ubuntu: 17.04
Desktop environment: Unity
unity:
  Installed: 7.5.0+17.04.20170407.1-0ubuntu1
  Candidate: 7.5.0+17.04.20170407.1-0ubuntu1
libqt5core5a:

  Candidate: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Version table:
 *** 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1 500
        500 http://ca.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu zesty/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
libqt5dbus5:
  Installed: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Candidate: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Version table:
 *** 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1 500
        500 http://ca.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu zesty/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
libqt5gui5:
  Installed: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Candidate: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Version table:
 *** 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1 500
        500 http://ca.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu zesty/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
libqt5network5:
  Installed: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Candidate: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Version table:
 *** 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1 500
        500 http://ca.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu zesty/main amd64 Packages
        100 /var/lib/dpkg/status
libqt5widgets5:
  Installed: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Candidate: 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1
  Version table:
 *** 5.7.1+dfsg-2ubuntu4\~1 500
        500 http://ca.archive.ubuntu.com/ubuntu zesty/main amd64 Packages

Steps to reproduce:

1)  set 'minimize to task bar':
i) go into options -> window -> put checkmark in minimize to the tray instead of the task bar. 
ii) make sure you have 'minize on close' also set(make sure there is a checkmark in it) or bad things might happen
ii) hit OK

2) minimize bitcoin-classic

3) via the system tray icon, 'show' bitcoin-classic again.

what should happen:
alt-tab menu contains bitcoin-classic so you can alt-tab to other applications and back
what does happen:
alt-tab menu does not contain bitcoin-classic

what also should happen:
file settings help menu should be available when hitting alt key
what does happen:
hitting and holding alt key does nothing

what also should happen
file settings help menu should be available when you move the pointer to top of the screen
what does happen
moving pointer to the top of the screen when bitcoin-classic is current application does nothing.

This was a problem with bitcoin-core but they claim to have fixed it.
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/1242
but after that other projects derived from bitcoin claim it isn't fixed
https://github.com/NeuCoin/neucoin/issues/20
this may be a unity bug 
https://bugs.launchpad.net/unity/+bug/1001498
and here is the reason why i report these 3 things as one bug -- according to this bug report minimizing causes more things than that to vanish...it really does seem like something is missing on the minimize/restore process that isn't just each individual issue.

this PR claims to resolve it
https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/pull/3493
alas i do not have a bitcoin-core enviornment in unity yet to confirm.

issue.title: refactor: Make BitcoinCore class reusable
issue.body:
This PR makes the `BitcoinCore` class reusable, i.e., it can be used by the widget-based GUI or by the [QML-based](https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/tree/main/src/qml) one, and it makes the divergence between these two repos minimal.

The small benefit to the current branch is more structured code.

Actually, this PR is ported from https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/pull/10.
The example of the re-using of the `BitcoinCore` class is https://github.com/bitcoin-core/gui-qml/pull/11.
